title: Firefox 39.0beta Beta

notes.note:
[Share Hello URLs][1] with social networks


  


  [1]: https://support.mozilla.org/kb/share-firefox-hello-social

Project Silk: [Smoother animation and scrolling][1] (Mac OS X)


  [1]: https://hacks.mozilla.org/2015/01/project-silk/

[WOFF2][1] (Web Open Font Format 2.0) fonts are now supported by default


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/Guide/WOFF

Support for 'switch' role in [ARIA 1.1][1] (web accessibility)


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/Accessibility/ARIA

SafeBrowsing [malware detection lookups][1] enabled for downloads (Mac OS X and Linux)


  [1]: https://support.mozilla.org/kb/how-does-phishing-and-malware-protection-work
Support for new Unicode 8.0 skin tone emoji
Removed support for insecure SSLv3 for network communications

NPAPI Plug-in performance improved via [asynchronous initialization][1]

  [1]: http://dblohm7.ca/blog/2014/06/17/asynchronous-plugin-initialization-an-introduction/
Performance of displaying dashed lines is improved (Mac OS X)
Malware detection service for downloads now covers common Mac file types

Added support for [CSS Scroll Snap Points][1]


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/tag/CSS%20Scroll%20Snap%20Points

[List-style-type][1] now accepts a string value


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/list-style-type

Cascading of [CSS transitions and animations][1] now matches the current spec


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/Guide/CSS/Using_CSS_animations

Enable the [Fetch API][1] for network requests from dedicated, shared and service workers


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/Fetch_API

Implemented [`<link rel="preconnect">`][1] allowing anticipation of a future connection without revealing any information

  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/HTML/Link_types
Drag and drop enabled for nodes in Inspector markup view
Web Console input history persists even after closing the toolbox

Cubic bezier tooltip now shows a gallery of [timing-function presets for use with CSS animations][1]


  [1]: http://jtgi.me/adding-presets-to-firefox-dev-tools/
localhost is now available offline for WebSocket connections
Improve performance of IPv6 fallback to IPv4
Fix incomplete downloads being marked as complete by detecting broken HTTP1.1 transfers
Security state indicator on a page now correctly ignores loads caused by previous pages

Fixed an issue where a Hello conversation window would sometimes fail to
open

system_requirements:
## Windows

### Operating Systems
 - Windows XP SP2
 - Windows Server 2003 SP1
 - Windows Vista
 - Windows 7
 - Windows 8

*Please note that while the 32-bit and 64-bit versions of Windows Vista and Windows 7 can be used to run Firefox, only 32-bit builds of Firefox are supported at this time.*

### Recommended Hardware
-  Pentium 4 or newer processor that supports SSE2
-  512MB of RAM
-  200MB of hard drive space

---

## Mac

### Operating Systems
- Mac OS X 10.6
- Mac OS X 10.7
- Mac OS X 10.8
- Mac OS X 10.9
- Mac OS X 10.10

### Recommended Hardware
- Macintosh computer with an Intel x86 processor
- 512 MB of RAM
- 200 MB hard drive space

---

## GNU/Linux

### Software Requirements

*Please note that GNU/Linux distributors may provide packages for your distribution which have different requirements.*

- Firefox will not run at all without the following libraries or packages:
    - GTK+ 2.18 or higher
    - GLib 2.22 or higher
    - Pango 1.14 or higher
    - X.Org 1.0 or higher (1.7 or higher is recommended)
    - libstdc++ 4.3 or higher
- For optimal functionality, we recommend the following libraries or packages:
    - NetworkManager 0.7 or higher
    - DBus 1.0 or higher
    - HAL 0.5.8 or higher
    - GNOME 2.16 or higher
